comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1
Build ID: 20110707182747

Steps to reproduce:

Exporting to iCal from Lightning 1.05. ICal can't import


Actual results:

ICal says " ICal can't read this calender file. No events have been added to your ICal calender.
I was also getting a validation error.


Expected results:

Should have imported perfectly. It worked fine in version 1.04 but stopped the day I updated the software.
comments.author: mardi@pushcreative.com.au

This is one of the events the validator flagged. Things seem to be splitting onto new lines for some reason (eg. ROLE=C[NEWLINE][SPACE]HAIR). Tried it in lightning 1.04 and noticed that this line-splitting behavior was not occurring.

comments.raw_text:
Modifying the ICS to omit the newly registered iana props makes this snippet validate on <http://severinghaus.org/projects/icv/>. This lets me assume that we export the event totally fine but ical is having trouble importing it.

The <NEWLINE><SPACE> thing is how ical files are line-wrapped in rfc5545.

comments.text:
So, minor issue with the STR in the year 2021. When I CTRL-SHIFT-C to open my calendars and then right-click my GMail Cal and export it, it exports/saves the calendar as foo@gmail.com. Meaning, the file extension is .COM so Windows thinks it's an executable and TB doesn't recognize it as an ICS file so it won't import it on the Import dialogue screen so you're basically stuck going nowhere. I had to manually change the file extension to be foo@gmail.com.ics.

After that, an import works just fine but GLACIALLY slow. So as far as I can see, this is working but needs some TLC as there's some bustage to the 1) export process resulting in 2) difficulty importing due to no appending of proper .ICS file extension to exported file and 3) SUPER SLOW importing.

Hope this is what you're looking for.
comments.raw_text:
So, minor issue with the STR in the year 2021. When I CTRL-SHIFT-C to open my calendars and then right-click my GMail Cal and export it, it exports/saves the calendar as foo@gmail.com. Meaning, the file extension is .COM so Windows thinks it's an executable and TB doesn't recognize it as an ICS file so it won't import it on the Import dialogue screen so you're basically stuck going nowhere. I had to manually change the file extension to be foo@gmail.com.ics.

After that, an import works just fine but GLACIALLY slow. So as far as I can see, this is working but needs some TLC as there's some bustage to the 1) export process resulting in 2) difficulty importing due to no appending of proper .ICS file extension to exported file and 3) SUPER SLOW importing.

Hope this is what you're looking for.
